name: discombobulation
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of being made to feel confused or uncomfortable by something: He showed his discombobulation by not being sure whether to sarcastically congratulate his rival or attack him. We feel nostalgia for the past and discombobulation about the future. See
discombobulate
More examplesFewer examplesPeople felt some discombobulation at the sight of Mr White laughing and joking with the former arch-enemy. Those who felt disorientated watching his last movie can expect the same discombobulation from this one, too.I did lose some sleep that night as my mind kept on reliving those moments of discombobulation.
